title: Beautiful Intervals
statementHtml:
You are given an integer nn and mm intervals. Each interval is of the form [li,ri][li,ri] and satisfies 1≤li≤ri≤n1≤li≤ri≤n. Note that there can be duplicate intervals.

Let pp be a permutation of length nn containing all the integers 0,1,2,…,n−10,1,2,…,n−1 exactly once.

There is a multiset MM which is initially empty.

For each interval [li,ri][li,ri]:

After processing all the intervals, MM will be equal to {v1,v2,…,vm}{v1,v2,…,vm}.

Your task is to construct a permutation pp of length nn containing all the integers 0,1,2,…,n−10,1,2,…,n−1 exactly once such that mex(M)mex⁡(M) is minimized.

∗∗mex(a)mex⁡(a) denotes the minimum excluded (MEX) of the integers in aa. For example, mex([2,2,1])=0mex⁡([2,2,1])=0 because 00 does not belong to the array, and mex([0,3,1,2])=4mex⁡([0,3,1,2])=4 because 00, 11, 22, and 33 appear in the array, but 44 does not.
inputSpecHtml:
The first line contains a single integer tt (1≤t≤10001≤t≤1000) — the number of test cases. Description of each testcase follows.

The first line contains two integers nn and mm (3≤n≤30003≤n≤3000, 1≤m≤30001≤m≤3000).

The next mm lines each contain two space-separated integers li,rili,ri (1≤li≤ri≤n1≤li≤ri≤n) each denoting an interval.

It is guaranteed that the sum of nn over all test cases does not exceed 30003000, and the sum of mm over all test cases does not exceed 30003000.
outputSpecHtml:
For each testcase, print a permutation pp of length nn containing all the integers 0,1,2,…,n−10,1,2,…,n−1 exactly once such that mex(M)mex⁡(M) is minimized.

If there are multiple answers, you may print any one of them.
noteHtml:
For the first testcase, if we choose to construct p=[2,0,1]p=[2,0,1], then M={mex(2,0)}={1}M={mex⁡(2,0)}={1}. Now, mex(M)=0mex⁡(M)=0.

For the third testcase, if we choose to construct p=[0,2,1,3]p=[0,2,1,3], then M={mex(0,2),mex(2,1),mex(1,3),mex(0),mex(3)}={1,0,0,1,0}M={mex⁡(0,2),mex⁡(2,1),mex⁡(1,3),mex⁡(0),mex⁡(3)}={1,0,0,1,0}. Now, mex(M)=2mex⁡(M)=2.

For the fourth testcase, if we choose to construct p=[2,0,1,3,4]p=[2,0,1,3,4], then M={mex(1,3,4),mex(2),mex(0,1,3),mex(4)}={0,0,2,0}M={mex⁡(1,3,4),mex⁡(2),mex⁡(0,1,3),mex⁡(4)}={0,0,2,0}. Now, mex(M)=1mex⁡(M)=1.

For the fifth testcase, if we choose to construct p=[3,1,0,2]p=[3,1,0,2], then M={mex(3,1,0),mex(1,0,2)}={2,3}M={mex⁡(3,1,0),mex⁡(1,0,2)}={2,3}. Now, mex(M)=0mex⁡(M)=0.
